intro: Omphalodes rugulosa, commonly known as the rough pimpernel, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or red in color. The plant has hairy, often rugose (rough) leaves that are lance-shaped and may have a slightly serrated edge. It thrives in sunny, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides. Omphalodes rugulosa is known for its short flowering period in late spring to early summer.
